long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Voxulus is browser extension that helps people with motor disabilities have an easier time navigating the web by combining head movement to simulate your typical mouse cursor and voice commands in order to perform typical tasks such as clicking, writing, scrolling, tab management, etc.

Instructions:
 - first you need to give chrome permissions to access your web cam and microphone
 - when you click on the extension a special tab should open which will be used to capture your voice (so you better keep that open for the tool to work properly). This page also specifies which voice commands are available to you.
 - after that, you're ready to navigate the web without your mouse and keyboard!

Demos:
 - Reading a news article and retweeting it: https://youtu.be/40zUF6EQlds
 - Writing and sending an email through outlook: https://youtu.be/5tHqg0gkcto
 - Watching and commenting a youtube video: https://youtu.be/jklxHEjbmfI
 - Online shopping at amazon: https://youtu.be/qdDpNSJD4JY

You can find more about our tool by reading a paper we wrote about it:
 - https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BhhAQds5F-yn3ngyKVFs2kSE7fUJ4fO7/view?usp=sharing

Feel free to contact voxulus@gmail.com for any question!
